author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Rains play spoilsport in Heber Springs camping groundTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Rains play spoilsport in Heber Springs camping ground
Rain stalled the start of the summer for a city used to heavy tourist traffic.
This summer things are a little slow mainly because the water was so high during the Fourth of July. The high water level in the camp grounds kind of killed business coming in. However, the late summer spike in temps and consistent trend of blue skies, recovered their business.
Heber Springs Mayor, Jimmy Clark said Greers Ferry Lake has 19 boat ramps, and are all of them are currently at capacity.
Clark also said the city had record numbers at their two main summer events.
During their Fourth of July fireworks show, they parked 800 cars, and for their Card Board Boat races, they parked 1,600 cars.
More than 1,300 cars paid to come into Dam Site Park to cool off this Labor Day weekend, 70 percent of them from out of town.
The Heber Springs Chamber of Commerce said that all of their hotels and vacation rentals homes were occupied, with zero vacancies during Labour Day weekend.
